contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox government cabinet |cabinet_name = Government of the 14th Dáil<br/>{{small|6th Government of Ireland}} |cabinet_number = |jurisdiction = |incumbent = |image = Éamon de Valera 03.jpg |image_size = 150 |date_formed = 13 June 1951 |date_dissolved = 2 June 1954 |government_head = [[Éamon de Valera]] |government_head_history = |deputy_government_head = [[Seán Lemass]] |state_head = [[Seán T. O'Kelly]] |current_number = |former_members_number = |total_number = 12 |political_party = [[Fianna Fáil]] |legislature_status = Minority Government |opposition_cabinet = |opposition_party = |opposition_leader = [[John A. Costello]] {{small|([[Fine Gael]])}} |election = [[Irish general election, 1951|1951 general election]] |last_election = |legislature_term = [[14th Dáil]] |budget = |incoming_formation = |outgoing_formation = |previous = [[Government of the 13th Dáil]] |successor = [[Government of the 15th Dáil]] }} The [[14th Dáil]] was elected at the [[Irish general election, 1951|1951 general election]] on 30 May 1951 and first met on 13 June when the 6th [[Government of Ireland]] was appointed. The 14th Dáil lasted for 1,084 days. ==6th Government of Ireland==<!-- This section is linked from [[Éamon de Valera]] --> The 6th Government of Ireland (13 June 1951 – 2 June 1954) was formed by the [[Fianna Fáil]] party. {| class="wikitable" |- !Office !colspan="2"| Name |- ||[[Taoiseach]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Éamon de Valera]]''' |- |[[Tánaiste]] ! rowspan=2 style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |rowspan=2|'''[[Seán Lemass]]''' |- |[[Minister for Jobs, Enterprise and Innovation|Minister for Industry and Commerce]] |- |[[Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine|Minister for Agriculture]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Thomas Walsh (Irish politician)|Thomas Walsh]]''' |- |[[Minister for Defence (Ireland)|Minister for Defence]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Oscar Traynor]]''' |- |[[Minister for Education and Skills|Minister for Education]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Seán Moylan]]''' |- |[[Minister for Foreign Affairs and Trade|Minister for External Affairs]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Frank Aiken]]''' |- |[[Minister for Finance (Ireland)|Minister for Finance]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Seán MacEntee]]''' |- |[[Minister for Health (Ireland)|Minister for Health]] ! rowspan=2 style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |rowspan=2|'''[[James Ryan (Irish politician)|James Ryan]]''' |- |[[Minister for Social Protection|Minister for Social Welfare]] |- |[[Minister for Justice and Equality|Minister for Justice]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Gerald Boland]]''' |- |[[Minister for Communications, Energy and Natural Resources|Minister for Lands]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Thomas Derrig]]''' |- |[[Minister for the Environment, Community and Local Government|Minister for Local Government]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Patrick Smith (politician)|Paddy Smith]]''' |- |[[Minister for Posts and Telegraphs]] ! style="background-color: {{Fianna Fáil/meta/color}}" | |'''[[Erskine Hamilton Childers|Erskine H. Childers]]''' |} The government positions are listed in alphabetical order, rather than in terms of seniority. ==See also== *[[Members of the 14th Dáil]] *[[Parliamentary Secretaries of the 14th Dáil]] *[[Members of the 7th Seanad]] *[[Dáil Éireann]] *[[Constitution of Ireland]] *[[Politics of the Republic of Ireland]] {{Governments of Ireland|state=collapsed}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Government Of The 14th Dail}} [[Category:Governments of Ireland]]
